WorkItem.ClosedComment:
If you're adding a new file to a project, you'll be given a set of valid files for that project type. So in a VB project you would not see 'Add New Item' present Typescript files, much like you wouldn't see it offer C# files. In a C# project you will not see Typescript files in the 'Add New Item' dialog either.

File -> New -> File adds a new file of any type, it doesn't care about what project you currently have loaded. That's why the left sidebar in that dialog lets you filter by various types (like C# vs VB items). That doesn't mean adding that file type to your current project type makes any sense though.

Typescript items currently just show up as C# in the places you noted because we use the C# project format and don't have our own project system at the moment.
WorkItem.Description:
Tried add new file in the dialog in VS12 and even with searching didnt find anything looking like a ".ts" file. Then started a new Project, this one "Html Application with TypeScript" something... There a ".ts" shows up, but under "c#"... 

But if I create a new file using CTRL-N and type then "type" it shows up... Strange...?
WorkItem.Summary: New Ts File not shown in VB Projects
